README
info:
This flow implements an out of the box, generic
device simulator, that can create, monitor 
and control virtual/simulated devices, whose behaviors
are described as Node-RED flows using the Virtual_IoT_Device
node types.

__There is no need to modify this flow in order to create and 
emulate virtual devices__

## Connecting the simulator to device behavior flows
To connect a virtual device to the simulation dashboard, you need to connect the *__StartDevice__* and  *__StopDevice__* output links in the simulator flow to 
the *__start virtual device__* and *__stop virtual device__* nodes in the device behavior flow (respectively)

## Using the dashboard UI
The dashboard UI is part of the Node-RED application dashboard 
which is in _[application URL]/ui_.
After opening the dashboard, select the _Simulation_ 
page (top left menu/side bar) to view the virtual devices dashboard.
You can create/delete multiple instances for every 
device type as well as view/change their property values.
The devices are auto generated in the IoT Platform using IDs 
generated by the dashboard. 

### Note:
The flow relies on the the CloudantNoSQL DB Service (deployed by default) to persist device instances between simulation sessions.
